newsitem.title: USA: Prudential cuts 50 from futures floor operations.
newsitem.headline: Prudential cuts 50 from futures floor operations.

text.p: Prudential Securities Inc's futures division cut about 50 employees from their Chicago and New York floor operations, a Prudential spokesman said.
Roughly 30 employees in Chicago were cut late last week, and about 20 employees in New York were cut two weeks ago, he said.
"We felt we could more efficiently conduct this business with a reconstituted group of people," he said. "Obviously, we are reducing costs and trying to make it a more efficient operation.
"But we will be maintaining our presence on the floor," he added.
Prudential Securities is a subsidiary of Prudential Insurance Company of Newark, N.J.
Several futures traders and analysts at Prudential Securities said a large portion of the cuts occurred in currency futures at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME).
One trader said Prudential's floor staff on the IMM currency futures floor was cut by 60 percent. ((Derivatiives desk 312-408-8750))
